This rare occurrence, happening only 18 times between 1970-2050, offers a prolonged presence near sunset due to a shallow ecliptic angle. Visible globally, it connects skywatchers to nature's enduring cycles and ancient traditions.

title: Rare Australian fragments reveal lost ancient asteroid,crater mystery puzzled

This finding also aids in assessing future asteroid risks.

India, a long-time advocate for a two-state solution, notes the plan as over 65,000 Palestinians have been killed.

Techie couple found dead in Gurgaon flat; husband may have strangled wife first
description: A young software engineer couple, Ajay and Sweety, were found dead in their Gurgaon apartment, with police suspecting a murder-suicide. Ajay reportedly strangled Sweety before taking his own life, confessing in a video message to friends. Their troubled marriage, marked by separation and ongoing arguments, is believed to be the motive.

Scientists turn to the moon to catch spacetime’s faintest music
description: To detect gravitational waves, a detector must be isolated from all vibrations that could obscure the elusive signals. Even the world’s frontline observatories can thus only spot gravitational waves from 7 billion lightyears away. This may be about to change as cosmologists look forward to opening a new window on the gravitational sky

title: Trump administration opens proceedings to bar Harvard from federal funds
description: The Trump administration has initiated proceedings to block Harvard University from receiving federal funding, referring it to the suspension and debarment process. This move, citing "deliberate indifference" to antisemitism, could cut off billions in research grants across multiple agencies, escalating the conflict. Harvard has 20 days to challenge the referral.

description: India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan descended into controversy as the Indian team refused to accept the trophy from ACC President Mohsin Naqvi, citing his social media posts and diplomatic tensions. Naqvi, also Pakistan's interior minister, subsequently removed the trophy, leading to India celebrating without it. The incident escalated into a political spat between the two nations.

title: 'Stabbed her 45 times': B'luru man murders wife, hangs self; father discovers grisly scene
description: A 29-year-old man allegedly killed his 27-year-old wife by stabbing her multiple times, then ended his own life in their Bengaluru home on Sunday. Manju P, a nurse, sustained around 45 injuries. Police suspect Dharmaseelan Ramesh committed the act due to suspicions about her workplace friendships.

title: Ladakh: Govt intrigued at violence even after ‘unprecedented’ vikas; fringes in focus
description: Ladakh grapples with unrest despite significant post-2019 development, including enhanced connectivity, education, and tourism, officials claim. They find it ironic given the region's progress since gaining UT status. However, the violence stems from long-standing demands for statehood, Sixth Schedule protections, and resource control, which local bodies have consistently raised, overshadowing perceived development gains.

title: FTA push: EU envoy flags missed opportunity; calls for full engagement by year-end
description: The 13th India-EU FTA round was a "missed opportunity," though both aim for a year-end deal, with another round set for October 6. Lingering issues persist, notably India's Russia ties, including energy and military exercises, which the EU views as an impediment to deeper relations despite shared strategic diversification goals.

Police alleged delays, mismanagement, and chaos at actor Vijay’s rally triggered the fatal crowd crush. General secretary Bussy Anand and joint general secretary CTR Nirmal Kumar were also implicated.

Pothole pangs: Bengaluru college student run over by truck; residents flag bad roads
description: A 20-year-old student, Dhanushree, tragically died in Bengaluru after being run over by a speeding truck near Budigere Cross. While police investigate if potholes contributed, residents blame poor road conditions and lack of streetlights. The truck driver fled, and a case for negligence has been registered. This incident reignites concerns over city road safety and infrastructure.

title: Chennai drug bust: Bollywood actor held with 3.5kg cocaine; haul worth Rs 35cr
description: A Bollywood supporting actor was apprehended at Chennai airport with 3.5kg of cocaine, valued at ₹35 crore, in a joint Customs and DRI operation. Arriving from Singapore, the actor had the drugs concealed in his luggage's false bottom. Officials suspect he was a courier for cartels, possibly destined for Mumbai or Delhi.

title: Delhi 'godman' exposed: 'Torture room' unearthed at Vasant Kunj institute
description: Chaitanyananda Saraswati, accused of molesting 17 women, was taken by police to his institute for questioning about an alleged "torture room" and CCTV locations. His seized phone showed live campus surveillance access, even while he was on the run. Police also arrested an associate for threatening a victim's father.

description: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has issued an advisory for JEE Main 2026 aspirants to update Aadhaar details, UDID cards, and category certificates before registration begins in October 2025. The exam will be held in two sessions: January and April 2026. Candidates are urged to ensure accurate documents to avoid rejection. Official updates will be available at nta.ac.in and jeemain.nta.nic.in.

15 companies that are now part of Apple's iPhone supply chain in India
description: Apple has dramatically expanded its iPhone manufacturing in India, with one in five iPhones now produced domestically. Its robust supply chain includes nearly 45 companies, integrating over 20 Indian MSMEs across several states. Driven by the PLI scheme, India's ecosystem produced $45 billion worth of iPhones, exporting 76%. This surge propelled smartphone exports to become India's top export by 2024-25.

title: Accenture layoffs: 11,000 cut; CEO says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
description: Accenture has laid off over 11,000 employees in the past three months, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.
